extendedIngredients.name: bacon
extendedIngredients.original: 4 ounces (about 5 slices) bacon, cut into 1-by-1/2-inch strips

extendedIngredients.name: granny smith apples
extendedIngredients.original: 2 Granny Smith apples, cored and diced
extendedIngredients.originalName: Granny Smith apples, cored and diced

extendedIngredients.name: onions
extendedIngredients.original: 2 medium onions, peeled and thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.name: red cabbage
extendedIngredients.original: 1 head red cabbage, quartered, cored, and thinly sliced
extendedIngredients.originalName: red cabbage, quartered, cored, and thinly sliced

title: Healthy & Delicious: Red Cabbage With Apples and Honey
summary: Healthy & Delicious: Red Cabbage With Apples and Honey might be just the side dish you are searching for. This recipe makes 8 servings with 253 calories, 4g of protein, and 6g of fat each. For $1.25 per serving, this recipe covers 13% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. Head to the store and pick up onions, coriander seeds, cardamom pods, and a few other things to make it today. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 41%, this dish is pretty good. Similar recipes are Healthy & Delicious: Curried Pork with Apples, Healthy & Delicious: Pork Roast en Cocotte with Apples and Shallots, and Healthy and Delicious: Baked Apples With Barley-Sausage Pilaf.
instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Put a rack in the lower third of the oven and preheat the oven to 300ºF.                                                                                                                            2                                                                            In a spice grinder or clean coffee grinder, finely grind the cardamom and coriander seeds. Bring the honey to a boil in a small saucepan. Add the ground spices, apple juice, and white wine vinegar. Bring to a boil, and reduce the liquid by half.                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Meanwhile, in a medium cast-iron pot or Dutch oven, cook the bacon over medium-high heat until translucent, 5 to 7 minutes. Add the onions and cook for 5 minutes more. Add the red cabbage and apples and cook, stirring, until softened, about 15 minutes. Pour the reduced honey-apple mixture over the cabbage and toss to coat. Cover the pot and transfer it to the oven.                                                                                                                            4                                                                            Braise for 2 hours, or until the cabbage is very tender.

steps.step: Put a rack in the lower third of the oven and preheat the oven to 300ºF.
In a spice grinder or clean coffee grinder, finely grind the cardamom and coriander seeds. Bring the honey to a boil in a small saucepan.
Add the ground spices, apple juice, and white wine vinegar. Bring to a boil, and reduce the liquid by half.
Meanwhile, in a medium cast-iron pot or Dutch oven, cook the bacon over medium-high heat until translucent, 5 to 7 minutes.
Add the onions and cook for 5 minutes more.
Add the red cabbage and apples and cook, stirring, until softened, about 15 minutes.
Pour the reduced honey-apple mixture over the cabbage and toss to coat. Cover the pot and transfer it to the oven.
Braise for 2 hours, or until the cabbage is very tender.
